reviews.review_msg: if you get an educ471 with him, drop it and take it another year with a different prof. other educ471 setup is mostly weekly discussions and about 5000-7000 words total. Senyshyn's version - 19,700 words. if you end up with this guy, pray you are graded by his very nice TA instead of a 74-year-old who is too senile to use Canvas.

Not clear of what is expected of you in syllabus. Disrespectful to students. Deducts marks if you email him clarifying questions. Other people who have taken this class with other professors say the workload is not near as much as we received with Dr. Senyshyn. Texts have nothing to do with the subject matter of the course.

There is so many things that I could say about this prof but the most recent reviews really summarize how unbelievably horrible he is. In 4 years of post-secondary studies at Douglas, SFU, and KPU, this prof is by far the worst one I've unfortunately had the misfortune of taking! In layman terms, this guy embodies the meme "Old man yells at cloud"
His previous year's ratings are very deceiving. I'm astonished how he treats students. Ruined my semester.

Assigns 3-4 papers every week and made us buy his own book that has nothing to do with curriculum. We read the same 3 books every week and write the same essays every week and still learn nothing. Also scared to reach out for clarification cause he deducts marks if you do.

I have never experienced such disrespect from a prof. If you explain that you are struggling with the intense workload (16,000+ words), he will say to stop complaining & get back to work. No guidance, support, or compassion. I am in school to be a teacher and this was a great example of what not to become. The TA was lovely though.

His instructions regarding assignments are unclear. Unwilling to compromise on workload. Students can't ask for clarification with risking mark deducted from their final grade for emailing him. You'd think an educ prof would encourage comm between students and teachers, but I guess nature works in mysterious ways.

At the beginning of the course, I had thought this class would be straight forward. Syllabus only states that there will be 1 assignment per week, worth 100% of your grade. After the deadline to drop, assignments got way harder. He assigned 14,000+ mandatory words throughout the semester & tons of reading. He is also very rude. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Believes it's not insane giving 3-4 1000 word reflections per week. When you bring up the workload concern with him, his response is, "you got exactly what you signed up for, stop complaining." Of course, asking questions doesn't come without risk as well because he also threatens to deduct marks if you email him a "stupid question". AVOID THIS MAN

Beginning of sem: I am a nicr prof who wont give you a lot of work.

End of sem: 4 mandatory papers per week , "dont complain its useless"

For some reason SFU hired a professor who makes typos and grammar mistakes in his assignment description for a entirely reading and writing class. You learn absolutely NOTHING from his class and teaching. I have no words. What a scam of a class and professor.
the easiest one in 4 level educ course
The Worse Prof I have ever taken in sfu. we spent four hours setting there, watching a movie, doing our INDIVIDUAL presentation. Why we take this course?
really good prof!

One of the best professor at SFU! Knowledgable, kind and easy to approach. He teaches passion. Even if you might not understand all the readings he is actually looking for what you've learned instead of what you haven't. Why would he use others CDs to teach? If you show hard effort in your papers and presentations, he'll give you a good grade. Fair
there are points for coming to the class. prof is very helpful, but have to study for every class or you will pile up lot of readings to do if u start at the end of the semester.
The most fair deal in SFU. Prof want to earn payment from SFU and $40 from each student , student just sit for 4hours for at least B grade.

By far the worst class I took at SFU. I learned nothing of use to my future in teaching. He spent more time rambling on about his personal life and bragging about his accomplishments than teaching. He forces you to buy two of his own CD's at $20 each and bases a major project on them. I dreaded class each week. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Slava was the worst professor I have ever had. He forces students to buy his classical music CD's for the assignment. You also watch three movies that are not related to curriculum or curriculum development! I have not learned anything about curriculum or curriculum development.. take if you want an easy grade but you will be frustrated!!

Completely shameless with the promotion of his own music. Lessons frequently degenerated into long-winded stories of personal experiences.  It's a strange class, he is obviously very intelligent but his self-absorption is hard to choke down, I grew to really dislike this class

Senyshyn is way too interested in finding ways to get his students to listen to his music.  He forces students to write personal reflections about his own classical music, and actually asked me to touch up an assignment because I did not spend enough time on his own personal biography. Cakewalk of a class: just tell him how great his music is.
He is the best ever!! so kind!! take this class!!

Brilliant and caring prof--goes to the wall for his students; roots course in classical aesthetics and strives for new knowledge--the piano playing will stay with you for life. Materials highly useful and well coordinated with course outcomes. Thank-You!

Not too impressed that the class has nothing to do with the topic and we were forced to buy not only his book, but also his CD's. It sure was nice of him not to inform his students that instead of paying him $40 in class for his CD's (Most don't even have CD players!) you can buy his music on itunes for less than half that price!

The best prof I have ever had. He is caring, friendly, and very good at teaching. Course material is very interesting. Presentations and assignments are fun to do. Even though it is a 4 credit course the workload is not too heavy. Highly recommended Slava!
Not bad.

The distance education section is not taught nor marked by Senyshyn. Your grade is completely dependent on your TA. As this is a 400 level course, assignments are marked very academically. There are 2 online discussions to be completed every week, 6 major assignments, many readings, and a take-home final exam. Be prepared to work very hard!

be aware that he's very concerned with attendence although he doesn't take it in the evaluation of this course. To him the attendence is something related to repecting him, & certainly it's worthwhile to attend his class. He's indeed a well-known pianist in case you don't know. He's humble too when I talked with him about his piano performance.

An excellent professor ever!! Very knowledgable, kind and approachable. Passionate in what he's teaching. Even if you might not understand all the readings he is actually looking for what you've learned instead of what you haven't. If you show your hard effort in your papers and presentations, he'll give you a good grade with no doubt. But be aware

Nice guy, but I learned nothing from Slava; the students did all the lessons, most of which were lifted from www.lessonplanspage.com.  Nothing about unit planning or logical sequencing of lessons, just rambling, random discussions and long, pointless videos.  So much more could be done with this course - what a shame.  Change of prof would help.

With all due respect to Slava, but he is convinced he's the next Nietzsche or something. He's quite charming and well-educated but lacks humor about his own arrogance. Who knows - maybe I was in the presence of a great mind? Or in the presence of someone who just likes to blow his own horn a lot? Excellent piano skills though!!!
AWESOME!
So sweet, way too easy, very interesting but little focus on the actual topic of the class.  And man, can that guy play piano - and he'll be happy to indulge you.
the very best ever. be prepared to do work.
He's very nice, just come to class and be somewhat prepared and you'll do just f
